page.title: 04Thatching,Stebbing,Essex.
page.content: Thatching is one of the{oldest forms {of roofing}and with tiles was the traditional covering in this area. We have{our own thatcher}in Stebbing who also works in surrounding areas.He uses long straw called Maris rigen.This straw was used in the war and originated in France.It is grown locally near Saling airport.Good quality straw costs about Â£300 a ton.The straw is cut with a binder before it has completely ripened.It takes 5 to 6 weeks to thatch an average roof and the hardest part to thatch is the eaves.Tools used are tractors,binder,straw elevator,straw and wire clippers,pitchfork,mallet and an eave knife.The straw is formed into large tiles called yealms and fixed with wooden pegs called spars or spindles made from nut hazel.the ridge is a separate patterned layer.
